title: Move print panel to Admin page with per-participant print functionality

requirements.summary: Remove print functionality from QuizSummary component
acceptanceCriteria: The QuizSummary component does not render a 'Print Results' button or any print-trigger element
The quiz summary screen still shows score, percentage, performance message, and per-question breakdown as before
No regression in quiz flow â€” Restart Quiz and navigation still work correctly

file_operations.description: Remove the 'Print Results' button and its onClick handler (handlePrint). Remove the hidden print-only sections (print-header and print-score classes). Retain all visible summary display elements including score, percentage, performance message, per-question breakdown, and the 'Restart Quiz' button. Ensure the component continues to display participant info and results correctly on screen.

requirements.summary: Add per-participant print panel to Admin page
acceptanceCriteria: Each row in the Admin leaderboard table has a clearly labeled 'Print' button
Clicking 'Print' on a row opens or renders a print-ready view for that specific participant
The printed output contains: participant name, date, topic, score (e.g., 9/12), percentage, and a per-question breakdown
A print-specific CSS media query ensures only the selected participant's result card is printed and the leaderboard table, navigation, and decorative elements are hidden during print
The print view does not interfere with the normal on-screen rendering of the Admin page

file_operations.description: Add state to track the currently selected participant for printing (e.g., selectedParticipant). Add a 'Print' button to each row in the leaderboard table that sets the selected participant. Create a hidden print-ready card component (positioned absolutely or with hidden class) that displays the selected participant's name, date, topic, score (e.g., '9/12'), percentage, and a per-question breakdown. The breakdown must show question text, selected answer, correct answer, and a correct/incorrect indicator. Use the existing getAllQuestions query data to cross-reference question texts with the participant's topic. Implement a handlePrint function that sets the selected participant state and triggers window.print(). Assign a unique class or data-attribute (e.g., 'admin-print-card') to the print card for targeting in CSS. Ensure the print card is hidden on screen and only visible in print media. Preserve the existing leaderboard ranking, summary stats, and refresh functionality without modification.

requirements.summary: Update print-specific CSS to target admin print card only
acceptanceCriteria: The @media print CSS rules target the admin participant print card and ensure all other page elements (leaderboard, header, buttons, navigation) are hidden during print
Printing from any page other than the admin print action does not produce unintended output
The print layout is clean and readable with appropriate font sizes and no clipped content

file_operations.description: Update the existing @media print block to hide all page elements by default (body * { display: none; }). Add an exception rule that shows only the admin print card (e.g., .admin-print-card and its descendants). Remove or override any existing print rules that target .print-header, .print-score, or quiz summary print sections. Ensure the admin print card uses block display, appropriate margins, readable font sizes (e.g., 12pt for body text, larger for headings), and no clipped or truncated content. Verify the printed layout includes all required fields: participant name, date, topic, score, percentage, and per-question breakdown with clear formatting.
